thread.title: Dallas Cowboys practice report: Dez Bryant makes an appearance; Greg Hardy absent
thread.title_full: Dallas Cowboys practice report: Dez Bryant makes an appearance; Greg Hardy absent | Dallas Morning News

author: Brandon George
title: Dallas Cowboys practice report: Dez Bryant makes an appearance; Greg Hardy absent
text:
IRVING -- Dallas Cowboys wide receiver Dez Bryant made an appearance at practice Thursday morning at Valley Ranch.
Bryant walked onto the practice field after the team had concluded its stretching and had separated into individual drills. Bryant was in shoulder pads and wearing a helmet, just like the other Cowboys players on Thursday. Bryant walked out alongside athletic trainer Britt Brown. He went over to the side of the field and jogged as he caught some passes.
Bryant, who is recovering from a fractured bone on the outside of his right foot, was working on the side to start practice and remained there during the portion open to the media.d
Cowboys coach Jason Garrett said that Bryant worked on the side throughout Wednesday's practice and did some running and cutting, but not at full speed.
Three other players weren't practicing Thursday for the Cowboys: defensive end Greg Hardy was out with an illness, defensive lineman David Irving was out with a sore back and safety Danny McCray was away from the team because of personal reasons. All three fully participated in practice Wednesday.
